articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Once an icon in the field of digital asset exchanges, BitMEX has unexpectedly turned guilty to a charge of violating the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA). This event is felt across the bitcoin community. The plea, a biting indictment of the platform’s operations, exposes a sinister world in which inadequate anti-money laundering (AML) rules clearly defied US financial regulations.
 
 
Prosecutors presented a picture of a business that aggressively wooed American consumers even as it claimed to be pulling out of the American market in 2015. BitMEX became a possible refuge for illegal financial activity thanks to a fragile façade of compliance, hiding a reality where little identity verification and a reckless attitude towards regulatory control let BitMEX grow.
 
US Attorney Damian Williams stated th…
articles.title: BitMEX Execs Plead Guilty: Years Of Money Laundering Exposed

articles.description:
In an effort to fulfil its goal to advance the global educational sector, the FLOKI team has disclosed that building schools in the aforementioned nations was just the beginning of its vision to provide high-level academic opportunities in underprivileged nations.
 
The team behind doggy-themed meme coin and Shiba Inu competitor, Floki (FLOKI) has unveiled plans to build a school in India, taking a proactive step towards leveraging blockchain technology to facilitate its philanthropic efforts. 
 
Floki To Build A New School In India
 
On June 9, the Floki team announced a new initiative to build a school in India on X (formerly Twitter). Expressing excitement for the project, the Floki team disclosed that its school development plans in India were a positive step towards revolutionizing th…
articles.title: Shiba Inu Competitor FLOKI Pushes The Envelope With Promise To Build Schools In India

articles.author: Helene Braun
articles.description: Jumping in on a continued effort by wallet makers to simplify access and user experience, particularly for newcomers, Coinbase (COIN) is introducing an app that lets users manage all of their on-chain wallets and activities in one place, the company announced Thursday.
articles.title: Coinbase Unveils Web App To Track Personal Onchain Wallets

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: San Francisco crypto firm Coinbase has introduced a new web application for its wallet, designed to provide users with a unified platform for managing onchain assets. The application aims to simplify the experience for users by offering a comprehensive view of their crypto holdings across various wallets and chains. Coinbase Unveils Web App to Bolster […]
articles.title: Coinbase Launches New Wallet Web App to Streamline Onchain Activity

articles.author: Oliver Knight
articles.description: More than $1.6 billion has been lost to hacks and rug pulls on BNB Chain since 2017, making it the primary target for criminals, Immunefi said.
articles.title: Hacks, Rug Pulls Cost BNB Chain $1.6B Since Inception: Immunefi

articles.author: William Paul Peckham
articles.description: The devices in our hands form the basis for a decentralized internet, says William Paul Peckham, Chief Business Officer of APhone.
articles.title: DePIN Doesn’t Need New Infrastructure

articles.author: Jesse Hamilton
articles.description: In the saga to overturn the SEC's crypto accounting policy – SAB 121 – lawmakers failed to overturn President Joe Biden's veto.
articles.title: U.S. House Fails to Override Biden's SEC Veto of Bill That Would End Controversial SEC Guidance

articles.author: Beth Haddock, Sarah Morton
articles.description: The coming years are crucial for compliance and risk in crypto. Beth Haddock discusses strategies advisors can take to protect their brand while serving clients as fiduciaries.
articles.title: Crypto for Advisors: Crypto and Compliance

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
In what could be a major victory for stablecoin issuance and regulation in the US, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has decided to drop its investigation into Paxos, providing a major boost to the stablecoin sector. 
 
According to a Fortune report on the matter, the decision was communicated to Paxos by Jorge Tenreiro, acting chief of the SEC’s crypto assets unit, and comes more than a year after the regulator sent a Wells notice to the New York-based institution, indicating a possible enforcement action over the Binance USD, or commonly known as BUSD, stablecoin, which Paxos developed in partnership with Binance.
 
Paxos Emerges From Year-Long Wells Notice Shadow
 
Per the report, Walter Hessert, Paxos’ head of strategy, expressed relief at the termination of the investigatio…
articles.title: BREAKING: SEC Drops Paxos Probe, Validates BUSD Non-Security Status

articles.author: Media
articles.description: Shiba Shootout (SHIBASHOOT) has gone viral after passing the $500,000 mark in its presale phase. This Wild West-themed meme coin is attracting investors worldwide and offers features unlike anything else on the market. Shiba Shootout – The Digital Wild West with P2E Mechanics Ever wondered what would happen if you mixed crypto with cowboys? That’s […]
articles.title: Is This the Next Meme Coin to Explode? Shiba Shootout Surges Past $500K in Presale

articles.author: Bitcoin.com
articles.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has decided to end its investigation into Paxos, a New York-based issuer of stablecoins, suggesting that stablecoins may not be treated as securities in most cases. This decision comes more than a year after the SEC sent Paxos a Wells Notice concerning the BUSD stablecoin, which is backed by […]
articles.title: SEC Withdraws Enforcement Action Against Paxos’ BUSD Stablecoin

articles.author: Tareq Sikder
articles.description:
Nuvei Corporation, a Canadian fintech company, announced a  
partnership with Mastercard today. This partnership will launch a new  
off-ramping solution in Europe. The solution allows consumers to convert their  
digital assets, including cryptocurrencies, into traditional fiat currency.  
They can do this using debit, credit, and prepaid cards.
Digital Finance Bridge 
This new function bridges digital and traditional finance.  
Consumers can spend their converted funds through Mastercard's global network.  
The off-ramping solution is part of Nuvei's modular payment platform. It aims  
to offer a simple and secure user experience.
Consumers can convert a wide range of supported digital  
assets into fiat currency. They can then transfer the funds to their eligible  
Mastercard in near re…
articles.title: Nuvei Partners with Mastercard: Crypto-to-Fiat Transfers and Global Use

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: The U.S. consumer price index (CPI) fell by 0.1% in June. The decline, primarily due to reduced gasoline prices, brought the annual inflation rate to its lowest in over three years. This news comes after U.S. President Joe Biden was accused of tapping into gasoline reserves ahead of the election to gain favor with voters. […]
articles.title: US Inflation Eases With 0.1% Drop in June; Biden Faces Gas Reserve Accusations
